qas.question: What was made Ukraine's official language in 1990?
For what reason would the Russian be spoken?
Where was the January 2 memorial service?

context: On October 28, 1989, the <a1_0>Ukrainian Supreme Soviet<a1_0/> decreed that effective January 1, 1990, <a0_0>Ukrainian<a0_0/> would be the official language of Ukraine, while Russian would be used for <a2_0>communication between ethnic groups<a2_0/>. On the same day The Congregation of the Church of the Transfiguration in Lviv left the Russian Orthodox Church and proclaimed itself the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church. The following day, thousands attended a memorial service at <a3_0>Demianiv Laz<a3_0/>, and a temporary marker was placed to indicate that a monument to the "victims of the repressions of 1939–1941" soon would be erected.
